org.usfirst.frc.team3494.robot.subsystems

Class Drivetrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SendableBase
      • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
        • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.PIDSubsystem
          • org.usfirst.frc.team3494.robot.subsystems.Drivetrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable

    public class Drivetrain
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.PIDSubsystem
    The drive train subsystem. Contains methods for controlling the robot's drive train. Also includes PID angle control via the AHRS mounted to the RoboRIO and PIDSubsystem.

    • Method Detail

      • initDefaultCommand

        protected void initDefaultCommand()
        Specified by:
        initDefaultCommand in class edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem

      • TankDrive

        public void TankDrive(double left,
                      double right)
        Drives the drive train tank drive style. The driveTrain will continue to run until stopped with a method like StopDrive().
        Parameters:
        left - The power to drive the left side. Should be a double between -1 and 1.
        right - The power to drive the right side. Should be a double between -1 and 1.

      • VelocityTank

        public void VelocityTank(double left,
                         double right)
        Drives the drive train tank drive style, in velocity mode (encoder edges / decisecond.) The drive train will continue to run until stopped with a method like StopDrive().
        Parameters:
        left - The speed to drive the left side to.
        right - The speed to drive the right side to.

      • ArcadeDrive

        public void ArcadeDrive(double xSpeed,
                        double zRotation,
                        boolean squaredInputs)
        Arcade drive method for differential drive platform.
        Parameters:
        xSpeed - The robot's speed along the X axis [-1.0..1.0]. Forward is positive.
        zRotation - The robot's rotation rate around the Z axis [-1.0..1.0]. Clockwise is positive.
        squaredInputs - If set, decreases the input sensitivity at low speeds.

        public void StopDrive()
        Stops all drive motors. Does not require re-enabling motors after use.
        Since:
        0.0.0

      • limit

        private static double limit(double num)
        Limit motor values to the -1.0 to +1.0 range.
        Parameters:
        num - The number to limit to [-1, 1].
        Returns:
        The limited value.

      • applyDeadband

        private double applyDeadband(double value,
                             double deadband)
        Returns 0.0 if the given value is within the specified range around zero. The remaining range between the deadband and 1.0 is scaled from 0.0 to 1.0.
        Parameters:
        value - value to clip
        deadband - range around zero
        Returns:
        Zero if the value is in the deadband, or the value unchanged.
